item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m Unique and I’ll be answering 3 questions on this page: Who am I? Why did I make this site? What am I most passionate about? Who am I?

item.title: Click-Through Rate Prediction with Stochastic Gradient Descent
Breaking Into Data Science
item.description: This post comes at a time where I, myself, am feeling the first-hire blues. An overall sense of burnout, frustration, confusion. I’ve gotten well acquainted with the phrases, “We reget to inform you at this time…”, “Although we were impressed with your interview/qualifications…”, “[insert insincere compliment here]. Unfortunately, [insert rejection statement here] …”. I heard somebody say a few weeks back to “teach the thing you want to learn”.` It seemed a bit paradoxical the first time I thought about it.

item.title: Image Tests
item.description: Photo by Manja Vitolic on Unsplash
Very basic page just to test how an embedded video might appear.

item.title: Now
item.description: What are you currently doing (in regard to your career) and how did you get there? How does your background make you unique? Currently, I’m attending Columbia University as a Master of Science candidate in applied mathematics.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.
